Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics

Welcome to your comprehensive guide on Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics. This book covers everything from fundamental concepts to advanced implementations in robotics.

Use the floating AI assistant at the bottom-right corner of the screen to ask questions about any topic in this book. The assistant can answer questions about ROS 2, Gazebo, NVIDIA Isaac, Vision-Language-Action systems, and more!

Book Structure​

This book is organized into 4 comprehensive modules:

  • Module 1: The Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2) - Middleware for robot control, Nodes, Topics, Services, and bridging Python agents to ROS
  • Module 2: The Digital Twin (Gazebo & Unity) - Physics simulation, environment building, and sensor simulation
  • Module 3: The AI-Robot Brain (NVIDIA Isaac™) - Advanced perception, synthetic data generation, and navigation
  • Module 4: Vision-Language-Action (VLA) - Convergence of LLMs and Robotics, voice-to-action, and cognitive planning

Getting Started​

Get started by exploring the modules using the sidebar. For any questions about the content, click on the floating AI assistant icon at the bottom-right of your screen.

What you'll learn​

  • How to implement robot control systems using ROS 2
  • How to create realistic physics simulations with Gazebo and Unity
  • How to develop AI-powered perception and navigation systems using NVIDIA Isaac
  • How to integrate LLMs with robotics for advanced human-robot interaction
